strategy_reasoning: Using a 'Garden Maintenance' metaphor makes dry backend fixes (renaming scripts, fixing URLs) feel cozy and tangible. It aligns with the brand's nature/growth identity while explaining technical stability improvements.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art closeup of a bee placing a seed into a pot labeled 'STAGE'. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and lavender gradient background. Chunky retro sprites, warm lighting. Metaphor for renaming 'publish' to 'stage'. Lo-fi aesthetic. Nostalgic but beautiful.
images.description: Visualizing the 'stage' vs 'publish' update as preparing seeds.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of a bee fixing a broken wooden fence in a garden. The fence represents 'stable URLs'. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and mint gradient background. Chunky pixels, warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like A Short Hike. Emotionally warm, secure.
images.description: Visualizing the URL stability fixes as repairing garden infrastructure.
